DataElement.preferredName: Head and Neck Surgery Specific Complication Wound Skin Subcutaneous Tissue Transplant Site Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Code that represents the transplant source of the skin subcutaneous tissue wound complication specific to head and neck surgery.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Head and Neck Surgery Specified Complication Subcutis Skin Injury Graft
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any surgery involving a structure in the head and neck region._Clearly and explicitly stated._Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure._Adipose tissue located under the dermis. It binds underlying structures with the skin. The subcutis is important in the regulation of temperature of the skin itself and the body. The size of this layer varies throughout the body and from person to person._Damage to the skin._Tissue or organ transplanted from a donor to a recipient.

Property.preferredDefinition: Adipose tissue located under the dermis. It binds underlying structures with the skin. The subcutis is important in the regulation of temperature of the skin itself and the body. The size of this layer varies throughout the body and from person to person.:Damage to the skin.:Tissue or organ transplanted from a donor to a recipient.

Concepts.definition: Adipose tissue located under the dermis. It binds underlying structures with the skin. The subcutis is important in the regulation of temperature of the skin itself and the body. The size of this layer varies throughout the body and from person to person.
Tissue or organ transplanted from a donor to a recipient.
